intro: Hemichaena levigata, commonly known as the smooth hemichaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
